summary: The Catastrophic Specialty Hospital Act of 2025 amends the Social Security Act to establish new payment rules for certain long-term care hospitals specializing in spinal cord injuries and acquired brain injuries under the Medicare program. It defines criteria for designating a hospital as a “catastrophic specialty hospital,” including discharge percentages, continuum of care, discharge numbers, out-of-state patient admissions, and commitment to neurorehabilitation research. Designated hospitals would receive alternative payment rules, exempting them from the standard system.
